org.rdkit.knime.util

Class LayoutUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.util.LayoutUtils

  • public final class LayoutUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class offers a collection of static utility methods for laying out and formatting components. It cannot be instantiated.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

        public static void applyDefaultProperties(java.awt.Button comp)
        Sets default background and foreground color as well as a default font for the specified component. It uses values defined as UIManager properties.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component to set default properties for. Can be null.

      • applyProperties

        public static void applyProperties(java.awt.Component comp,
                                   java.awt.Color colBack,
                                   java.awt.Color colFore,
                                   java.awt.Font font)
        Sets background and foreground color and a font for the specified component.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component to set properties for.
        colBack - Background color. Can be null to use parent color (not suggested due to differences between Java VMs).
        colFore - Foreground color. Can be null to use parent color (not suggested due to differences between Java VMs).
        font - Font. Can be null to use parent font (not suggested due to differences between Java VMs).

      • applyProperties

        public static void applyProperties(java.awt.Component comp,
                                   java.lang.String strKeyBackground,
                                   java.lang.String strKeyForeground,
                                   java.lang.String strKeyFont)
        Sets background and foreground color and a font for the specified component.
        Parameters:
        comp - Component to set properties for. If null nothing happens.
        strKeyBackground - Key for background color defined in javax.swing.UIManager. If it is null or not found first the key "control" will be tried, and if still null, a "fallback" color will be taken.
        strKeyForeground - Key for background color defined in javax.swing.UIManager. If it is null or not found first the key "textText" will be tried, and if still null, a "fallback" color will be taken.
        strKeyFont - Key for font defined in javax.swing.UIManager. If it is null or not found first the key "Label.font" will be tried, and if still null, a "fallback" font will be taken.

      • centerWindow

        public static void centerWindow(java.awt.Window window)
        Call this method to calculate coordinates dependent on the screen size to center the specified window.
        Parameters:
        window - Window to center in the screen. Can be null.

      • changeColor

        public static java.awt.Color changeColor(java.awt.Color color,
                                         int difference)
        Takes the specified color and makes it darker or lighter according to the specified difference.
        Parameters:
        color - Original color to be changed. Can be null.
        difference - Difference to be applied to the red, green and blue values of the original color.
        Returns:
        New color object build from the original color and the specified differences. Returns null, if the passed in color was null.

      • constrain

        public static void constrain(java.awt.Container cont,
                             java.awt.Component comp,
                             int iGridX,
                             int iGridY,
                             int iGridWidth,
                             int iGridHeight)
        Helper function to work with GridBagConstraints in a GridBagLayoutManager. For the following constraints we use defaults:
        iFill= NONE
        iAnchor= NORTHWEST
        dWeightX= 0.0
        dWeightY= 0.0
        iTop= 0
        iLeft= 0
        iBottom= 0
        iRight= 0
        Parameters:
        cont - Container that has a GridBagLayout which the component has to be added to. Cannot be null.
        comp - Component to be added and layed out.
        iGridX - Specifies the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0. The value RELATIVE specifies that the component be placed just to the right of the component that was added to the container just before this component was added.
        iGridY - Specifies the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0. The value RELATIVE specifies that the component be placed just below the component that was added to the container just before this component was added.
        iGridWidth - Specifies the number of cells in a row for the component's display area. Use REMAINDER to specify that the component be the last one in its column. Use RELATIVE to specify that the component be the next-to-last one in its column.
        iGridHeight - Specifies the number of cells in a column for the component's display area. Use REMAINDER to specify that the component be the last one in its row. Use RELATIVE to specify that the component be the next-to-last one in its row.

      • constrain

        public static void constrain(java.awt.Container cont,
                             java.awt.Component comp,
                             int iGridX,
                             int iGridY,
                             int iGridWidth,
                             int iGridHeight,
                             int iTop,
                             int iLeft,
                             int iBottom,
                             int iRight)
        Helper function to work with GridBagConstraints in a GridBagLayoutManager. For the following constraints we use defaults:
        iFill= NONE
        iAnchor= NORTHWEST
        dWeightX= 0.0
        dWeightY= 0.0
        Parameters:
        cont - Container that has a GridBagLayout which the component has to be added to. Cannot be null.
        comp - Component to be added and layed out.
        iGridX - Specifies the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0. The value RELATIVE specifies that the component be placed just to the right of the component that was added to the container just before this component was added.
        iGridY - Specifies the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0. The value RELATIVE specifies that the component be placed just below the component that was added to the container just before this component was added.
        iGridWidth - Specifies the number of cells in a row for the component's display area. Use REMAINDER to specify that the component be the last one in its column. Use RELATIVE to specify that the component be the next-to-last one in its column.
        iGridHeight - Specifies the number of cells in a column for the component's display area. Use REMAINDER to specify that the component be the last one in its row. Use RELATIVE to specify that the component be the next-to-last one in its row.
        iTop - Specifies the external padding of the component on top, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area on top.
        iLeft - Specifies the external padding of the component on the left, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area on the left.
        iBottom - Specifies the external padding of the component at the bottom, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area at the bottom.
        iRight - Specifies the external padding of the component on the right, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area on the right.

      • constrain

        public static void constrain(java.awt.Container cont,
                             java.awt.Component comp,
                             int iGridX,
                             int iGridY,
                             int iGridWidth,
                             int iGridHeight,
                             int iFill,
                             int iAnchor,
                             double dWeightX,
                             double dWeightY,
                             int iTop,
                             int iLeft,
                             int iBottom,
                             int iRight)
        Helper function to work with GridBagConstraints in a GridBagLayoutManager.
        Parameters:
        cont - Container that has a GridBagLayout which the component has to be added to. Cannot be null.
        comp - Component to be added and layed out.
        iGridX - Specifies the cell at the left of the component's display area, where the leftmost cell has gridx=0. The value RELATIVE specifies that the component be placed just to the right of the component that was added to the container just before this component was added.
        iGridY - Specifies the cell at the top of the component's display area, where the topmost cell has gridy=0. The value RELATIVE specifies that the component be placed just below the component that was added to the container just before this component was added.
        iGridWidth - Specifies the number of cells in a row for the component's display area. Use REMAINDER to specify that the component be the last one in its column. Use RELATIVE to specify that the component be the next-to-last one in its column.
        iGridHeight - Specifies the number of cells in a column for the component's display area. Use REMAINDER to specify that the component be the last one in its row. Use RELATIVE to specify that the component be the next-to-last one in its row.
        iFill - This field is used when the component's display area is larger than the component's requested size. It determines whether to resize the component, and if so, how. The following values are valid for fill:
        NONE: Do not resize the component.
        HORIZONTAL: Make the component wide enough to fill its display area horizontally, but do not change its height.
        VERTICAL: Make the component tall enough to fill its display area vertically, but do not change its width.
        BOTH: Make the component fill its display area entirely.
        iAnchor - This field is used when the component is smaller than its display area. It determines where, within the display area, to place the component. Possible values are CENTER, NORTH, NORTHEAST, EAST, SOUTHEAST, SOUTH, SOUTHWEST, WEST, and NORTHWEST.
        dWeightX - Specifies how to distribute extra horizontal space. The grid bag layout manager calculates the weight of a column to be the maximum weighty of all the components in a row. If the resulting layout is smaller horizontally than the area it needs to fill, the extra space is distributed to each column in proportion to its weight. A column that has a weight zero receives no extra space. If all the weights are zero, all the extra space appears between the grids of the cell and the left and right edges.
        dWeightY - Specifies how to distribute extra vertical space. The grid bag layout manager calculates the weight of a row to be the maximum weightx of all the components in a row. If the resulting layout is smaller vertically than the area it needs to fill, the extra space is distributed to each row in proportion to its weight. A row that has a weight of zero receives no extra space. If all the weights are zero, all the extra space appears between the grids of the cell and the top and bottom edges.
        iTop - Specifies the external padding of the component on top, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area on top.
        iLeft - Specifies the external padding of the component on the left, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area on the left.
        iBottom - Specifies the external padding of the component at the bottom, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area at the bottom.
        iRight - Specifies the external padding of the component on the right, the minimum amount of space between the component and the edges of its display area on the right.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The argument does not meet the specifications.

      • copyImageToClipboard

        public static boolean copyImageToClipboard(java.awt.Image pImage)
        Call this method to copy an image to the system clipboard.
        Parameters:
        pImage - The Image object to copy.
        Returns:
        True if the save is successful; otherwise false.

      • createImageIcon

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon createImageIcon(java.lang.Object objRoot,
                                                    java.lang.String strPath,
                                                    java.lang.String strDescription)
        Call this method to create an image icon associated with the specified object.
        Parameters:
        objRoot - The object, which loads the image as resource. Can be null.
        strPath - Resource path (absolute or relative to the specified root object). Must not be null. An absolute example: "/com/novartis/nibr/knime/images/loading.gif".
        strDescription - A description of the image to be loaded. Can be null.
        Returns:
        ImageIcon object containing the loaded image, or null, if image could not be loaded.

      • createImageIcon

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon createImageIcon(java.lang.Class<?> rootClass,
                                                    java.lang.String strPath,
                                                    java.lang.String strDescription)
        Call this method to create an image icon associated with the specified object.
        Parameters:
        rootClass - The class which loads the image as resource.
        strPath - Resource path (absolute or relative to the specified root object). Must not be null. An absolute example: "/com/novartis/nibr/knime/images/loading.gif".
        strDescription - A description of the image to be loaded. Can be null.
        Returns:
        ImageIcon object containing the loaded image, or null, if image could not be loaded.

      • loadImage

        public static java.awt.Image loadImage(java.lang.Object objRoot,
                                       java.lang.String strResourcePath)
        Call this method to load an image associated with the specified object.
        Parameters:
        objRoot - The object, which loads the image. Must not be null.
        strResourcePath - Resource path starting from the root package of the Java application. Must not be null. An example: "/com/novartis/nibr/knime/images/loading.gif".
        Returns:
        Image object containing the loaded image, or null, if image could not be loaded.

      • saveImage

        public static boolean saveImage(java.awt.Image pImage,
                                java.lang.String strPath)
        Call this method to save an image as a JPEG.
        Parameters:
        pImage - The Image object to save.
        strPath - The Path, including filename where the Image will be saved. If the file already exists it will be overwritten.
        Returns:
        True if the save is successful; otherwise false.

      • createUniqueComboBoxItem

        public static java.lang.Object createUniqueComboBoxItem(java.lang.String item)
        Creates a unique combo box item.
        Parameters:
        item - The name of the item to be shown in the combo box.
        Returns:
        An object that wraps the passed in string item and returns it in when the toString() method gets called on that object.

      • correctKnimeDialogBorders

        public static void correctKnimeDialogBorders(javax.swing.JPanel panel)
        Can be called with a tab panel component that is derived from a JComponent. This method is used to set borders around the inner components of a tab panel.
        Parameters:
        Component - of a tab panel. Can be null.
